title: CryptoHealthPLus
author: CryptoHealthPLus
content: Crypto Health Plus wants to know What are the best practices for a successful Airdrop? Do you do it for a limited time with a limited amount of people that win? (Run 1 month, 1st 100, get 1000 CHP coins?)When do you pay it out at the end or as it is live? (If you ran it for the month of July do you pay it out at end of month, or as the 1-100 win?)How many tasks should you have to complete? (How many task should be completed on your social media channels to win?)I guess the best way to communicate for the winners would be email? Please share your ideas and past best practice experiences to help us build our community driven CHP Coin Drop. Thank you,

comments.author: cryptoaddictchie
comments.body: Airdrops is like a simple thing to do. Dont make it complicated, cause if theres a lot of task its not an airdrop but become a bounty instead. Most airdrops that succesfully release their projects have a simple one. Limited is good to make the value of that bevome worth it. If the project is in seed or private round, youll definitely need more airdrop program to help gain awareness of your project.Try to check projects on icodrops with airdrops, maybe youll get idea on good process.

comments.author: $anounimus$
comments.body: Quote from: CryptoHealthPLus on June 29, 2022, 06:43:27 PMCrypto Health Plus wants to know What are the best practices for a successful Airdrop? I guess the best way to communicate for the winners would be email? Airdrops are a marketing campaign often used by virtual currency startups, but they only work if a lot of people are interested in the product. To ensure the success of an Airdrop, it is important that you know your target audience well.Awarding prizes to winners using the airdrop technique is an excellent method of enabling a smooth and simple awarding without leaving anyone behind or interrupting the event. It would be wise to consider these techniques especially if you are planning your own award event or giveaway.My opinion for Airdrop Winners should be emailed their claim instructions. In addition, you are extending their communication to a commonly used channel of information to inform other members of the community about products and update to them.

comments.author: dimonstration
comments.body: Required participants to do certain task such as following your social media and sharing your project before they become eligible for the airdrop tokens. Never use a first come first serve basis because most likely you will  choose a bot and multiple account user that abused your airdrop, Use a raffle system and gleam.io to collect the data of your participants including the wallet address, There’s no need to contact them one by one if you have already there wallet address to send the rewards.

comments.author: jostorres
comments.body: Quote from: dimonstration on June 30, 2022, 09:52:58 AMRequired participants to do certain task such as following your social media and sharing your project before they become eligible for the airdrop tokens. Never use a first come first serve basis because most likely you will  choose a bot and multiple account user that abused your airdrop, Use a raffle system and gleam.io to collect the data of your participants including the wallet address, There’s no need to contact them one by one if you have already there wallet address to send the rewards. There are amazing raffle systems that check the participants and see what they are doing. This is why I personally believe that the best case would be using a premade system that checks all of these. I personally prefer sweepwidget over gleam.io to be fair. Not that gleam is a bad one, but it is one that rarely works properly and constantly creates trouble for the giveaway maker, and that is why sweepwidget is better.Plus, the design is very different, that one has a much better design whereas gleam.io has such a big early 2000's type of look which doesn't really fly well with the crypto community, you need a much better look to get people interested.
